poem:
Title: Echoes from Hebron

In Hebron's heart, a spectacle unfolds,
A man of medicine becomes death's hand.
Al-Sharif, lying still in desert's sand,
His blood a tale of virtue lost, retold.
A weapon wielded, not for healing, but for harm;
A life so quickly silenced, ne'er to stand.
In the shadowed streets of Contested Land,
The echoes of this moment raise alarm.
